TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit ColumnProvider extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides a base class for column providers.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Column providers must extend this class. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource> class and the ADO.NET Entity Framework class are providers that extend this class.

Docs.summary: Initializes the class for use by an inherited class instance. This constructor can only be called by an inherited class.

MemberSignature.Value: protected static System.ComponentModel.AttributeCollection AddDefaultAttributes (System.Web.DynamicData.ModelProviders.ColumnProvider columnProvider, System.ComponentModel.AttributeCollection attributes);

.method familystatic hidebysig class System.ComponentModel.AttributeCollection AddDefaultAttributes(class System.Web.DynamicData.ModelProviders.ColumnProvider columnProvider, class System.ComponentModel.AttributeCollection attributes) cil managed

protected: static System::ComponentModel::AttributeCollection ^ AddDefaultAttributes(System::Web::DynamicData::ModelProviders::ColumnProvider ^ columnProvider, System::ComponentModel::AttributeCollection ^ attributes);
static member AddDefaultAttributes : System.Web.DynamicData.ModelProviders.ColumnProvider * System.ComponentModel.AttributeCollection -> System.ComponentModel.AttributeCollection

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the `attributes` parameter does not contain the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.RequiredAttribute> collection, but the model provider requires this attribute, the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.RequiredAttribute> object is added. If the `attributes` parameter does not contain the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.StringLengthAttribute> collection and the column that is represented by this provider is a string, the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.StringLengthAttribute> object is added.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the column is an additional property that is not in the model's data context.
Docs.value: if the column is an additional property that is not in the model's data context; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Columns that are not in the data context typically come from a view or calculated property. The value of the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.ModelProviders.ColumnProvider.IsCustomProperty%2A> property can be used to determine whether column operations such as sorting are supported. For example, the implementation of the <xref:System.Linq.IQueryable?displayProperty=nameWithType> interface of the data model will not support sorting on properties that return `true` for the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.ModelProviders.ColumnProvider.IsCustomProperty%2A> property, because the column does not exist in the database.
